resources.string: Are you sure you want to clear saved “legal phonies”?\n\nThis action cannot be undone.
CrossWords needs your permission to post notifications, e.g. telling you an opponent has moved or that a updated wordlist is available.
The ability to send moves over the internet via MQTT is no longer supported on your version of Android.

Please let me know that you’ve seen this warning (via the “%1$s” button below). Very few people are still using this version of Android, and I hoped none of them was using CrossWords for networked play. I can try to work around this problem once I know it actually impacts someone.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete stats?
Keep this many hours of logs
Usually this means accepting invitations from the same device
CrossWords is staying awake to check for remote moves. Tap for more information.
Keep CrossWords awake to receive moves, even when it is not visible or the device is asleep. Note: may impact battery life.

For the best experience with multi-player games, CrossWords tries to remain active in the background checking for incoming moves. This can impact battery life, which is why Android discourages it, and why you will always see a notification when it is happening.
The move checker only runs when a move has been made in at least one networked game in the last %1$d hours. You can configure it, or disable it altogether, using the “%2$s” button below.
The Move Checker is currently running. It will stop in %1$dh%2$02dm unless a move is made or received.
The Move Checker is not currently running.
If you get tired of seeing the notification you can hide it in your device\'s Settings app. Get there with the button below.
Stopped at %1$s. Use this notification to relaunch.
How many hours to stay awake (1..72)
CrossWords will receive moves from other players more quickly if you enable the new Net Move Checker feature. The More info button will tell you how.
